crags.name: Olhava
crags.access_info:
Olhavanvuori is situated in the Repovesi National Park. Finnish Climbing Association has good co-operation with the park admistration and we like to keep it that way. Please act politely! Take your trash and all other trash with you! 

The walk-in is shortest from the north parking. It takes about 30 minutes on good roads. There's a well near the climbing site where you get water for cooking. Sometimes the bacteria can be too high for drinking, though. If the trash bins on park entrances are full or locked take your trash with you back to civilization.

During spring and summer many birds nest in Olhava. 


- Raven (korppi, Corvus corax) is known to nest between routes Puntari and Sammalr√§nni. If you see a raven nesting here or somewhere else, please climb other routes.

- Kaakkuri (Gavia stellata) is known to have a nest in the middle of the Olhavanlampi pond on her own small little island.  If you're a bad sleeper, please use earplugs. Kaakkuri is sometimes giving loud sounds during the morning hours and she has every right to do so! This is her territory.

There's a climbers boat courtesy of Finnish Climbing Association. You may use it as long as you don't break it. If you need to climb beyond sector Laatta (ie. Stradarotta or Tulenarkaa sectors), please walk the path from above. On good summer days the boat has high demand for pendeling between the shore and the Laatta island.

photo.caption: From the other side of the lake

crags.name: Pe√±√≥n de Ifach
crags.access_info:
Acces via the signs ''penon de ifach'' natural park and enter via the path and walk up to reach the north face. To reach the south go right before entering the parc and follow a road next to the sea. This will lead you towards the acces of the crag.

Dont leave any trash behind and be aware of the bird nesting season from march-may. Seagulls can be aggressive by defending their nests.

crags.name: Forte
crags.access_info:
Houses nearby so be quiet and no climbing after dark.

üöó
From Jyv√§skyl√§: 20km, 28min.
Head for the Tampere-road (E63), take the exit at Muurame and follow arrows for S√§yn√§tslo. Turn right to Lehtisaari/Muuratsalo. Once you're on Muuratsalo, keep driving "Saaritie" and take the 3rd turn to the right, onto  "Kortepellontie". At the T-section take a right turn (South) and keep driving 1.8km. 
The block will be on your left. 

When coming from Helsinki, you will enjoy a great and scenic road going over P√§ij√§nne. 

üö∂‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è
Nonexistent. 
Throw the pads out, start kr√§nkin 

Remember to keep it down for the residents.

Updated parking info at the end!

The path to 28.7 begins at the end of the road, BEHIND a small red cabin/gazebo. Should be obvious but don't walk on the fields!

The gazebo is private property and must not be used!

From Jyv√§skyl√§ drive north on E75. At Tikkakoski junction turn right torwards Laukaa. After 5,5km turn right on Soimarinteentie. After 450m park on left on a little road. Don't block the whole road. There is a space for two cars. Avoid driving further!

crags.name: Keljonkangas
crags.access_info: Jyv√§skyl√§st√§ (noin 6,8km). L√§hde ajamaan kohti Tamperetta 9/E63. Keljonkankaan liittym√§st√§ k√§√§nny kohti S√§yn√§tsalo, Kinkomaa, Keljonkangas. Liikennevaloista k√§√§nny vasemmalle Keljonkankaantie. 300m p√§√§st√§ k√§√§nny oikealle Hietatie. Aja noin 50m ja k√§√§nny vasemmalle Aapistie. T-risteyksess√§ k√§√§nny oikealle Soratie. Jatka noin 50m ja k√§√§nny vasemmalle. Parkkeeraa Keljonkankaan l√§hiliikuntapaikan parkkipaikalle.

crags.name: Jaanankallio
crags.access_info:
The cliff situates in a nature reserve. Use only paths, do not build open fires, take all trash with you.

üöó 55km/50min from Helsinki | 130km/1h30min from Tampere
When driving highway E12, take exit 6 for Hyvink√§√§. After leaving the highway, turn east (away from Hyvink√§√§) onto road 1361.
Stay on road 1361 (Kyt√§j√§ntie) for 5,7km / 6 min, park on the big parking on the right.

From the parking lot, cross the small stream on the right. Walk on the side of the field. DO NOT CROSS THE FIELD! In front of Jaanankallio you'll find a well visible path leading to the crag.

The path to the 'North face' starts from the top of 'Blackadder Wall'. The walk is about 500 m and takes only 5 minutes from the main sector.

crags.name: Patamankallio
crags.access_info: The crag is located north of Jyv√§skyl√§ near the Hirvaskangas ABC service station on E75. From the service station it is about 3 km drive on Hitonlahdentie and Hitonhaudantie. Park on the left side of the road on an old gravel extraction spot (hiekkakuoppa). There is a foot path going north over the sand dune into the forest. It is about 150 meter walk to the right end of the cliff.

crags.name: Havukallio
crags.access_info:
Maanomistajalta on tullut muutama toive Havukalliolla k√§ytt√§ytymisen suhteen:

Parkkipaikka

Parkkipaikan l√§pi johtaa tie pellolle, josta pit√§√§ p√§√§st√§ kulkemaan mm. puimurilla, asia on akuutti varsinkin juuri nyt kun viljaa korjataan. Puimuri on leve√§ ty√∂kone, pys√§k√∂ityjen autojen v√§liin j√§tett√§v√§ v√§hint√§√§n 4m leve√§ v√§yl√§.

Roskat
Ker√§√§th√§n roskasi talteen sek√§ parkkipaikalta ett√§ kallion juurelta. Hoidathan wc-asiasi ennen kalliolle saapumista, jos h√§t√§ kuitenkin yll√§tt√§√§, kaiva kuoppa pitk√§lle mets√§√§n, peittele j√§t√∂kset ja ker√§√§ paperit mukaasi. 


Tulenteko
Tulenteko on edelleen sallittua silloin kun mets√§palovaroitus ei ole voimassa. Sammutusvesi olisi hyv√§ pit√§√§ nuotion l√§hettyvill√§. El√§vi√§ puita tai oksia ei tietenk√§√§n saa katkoa nuotioon.




Varo varkaita!

Parkkipaikalla on vuosien varrella murtauduttu jo useamman kerran kiipeilij√∂iden autoihin, t√§n√§ kes√§n√§ tiett√§v√§sti jo kahdesti.




Havukallion yll√§pidosta huolehtii Lahden kiipeilyseura Kitka ry. Kunnioitathan t√§t√§ arvokasta vapaaehtoisty√∂t√§ noudattamalla n√§it√§ ohjeita kaikkien kiipeilij√∂iden yhteiseksi hyv√§ksi, KIITOS!

photo.caption: Miika Tuominen practising Tai Chi high above Calpe.

crags.name: Straumvassbotn
crags.access_info:
There is no climbing specific acces restrictions as of 2021. But throughout the year there will be roadworks due to the construction of a new hydroplant further up the valley. There can be heavy machinery on the road every day througout the week so be very aware of where you park.

The only sectors that have sort of clear footpath is the ones starting with sector "Nord og Ned" and up hill from there to the boulder Morkel. For all other boulders you just have to trust the GPS coordinates.

The area is not particularly child friendly, due to rugged terrain. But for some of the blocks nearer the road it can probably work out.

Camping is not alllowed along the lake. Use the camping ground in Straumen.

Poluting is absolutely forbidden as always, but this area is especially sensitive as the lake is a fresh water source.

photo.caption: Hoggeren. Start on two crimps sit down. Go right to ledge following micro crimps.

crags.name: Gjerdalen
crags.access_info:
The road up to the valley is only open from July 15th to October 15th due to reindeer herding. Climbing can be done  in the valley outside of this window but one has to be willing to walk in. 
üõ£üö´üöß
The seasonal road block (marked with a parking icon on the map) is 7 km down the road from the Lower Valley parking (and 13 km from the upper valley sectors!), and then it's a further 20-25 minutes approach to the Lower Valley sector.

There is another roadblock right by the Tranquility boulder that is closed all year. Therefore one has to walk in to the sectors Waterfall (1 km), Glacier Polish (1,5 km), Fragments (600 m) and Reinoksskardet (1,3 km). 

üèÉ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏èTo get to the sector Lower valley, park as marked on the map. Walk from here a little back down the road for about a 100 meters. Here you'll se a clearing of trees. Walk straight up on the right side of the clearing and more or less follow a small stream all the way up to the boulders. To describe the specific walk in access to the rest boulders here is complicated as Gjerdalen consist of many smaller collecions of blocks. Rely on the GPS coordinates and trails.

There are no climbing related access isues.

crags.name: Cresciano
crags.access_info:
Currently it's not allowed to drive up to the boulders. This means that cars need to be left down to the village, where one can walk up to the boulders. Please respect this driving and parking ban to avoid further issues!

Walking time from the village to the closest boulders: approximately 25min.

As always, respect the nature, other climbers and brush away tick marks.

photo.caption: Giani Clement on Story of two worlds (8C)

crags.name: Chironico
crags.access_info:
Chironico is a village situated in the north of the province (Kanton) Ticino (Tessin) of Switzerland. 
You can find all the parkings on the map view. Make sure to navigate to the correct one. 
You can walk between all the zones on foot too, but the distances are rather big. 
Searching for "Chironico boulder" on google maps will bring you to the higher "Nivo parking".
As in every place, be respectful, don't litter, only park where allowed,... The lower 2 Parkings near the village of Nivo have toilets and staying overnight in a van is tolerated. Be respectful so we can enjoy this for many years to come. 


The boulders can be found in four main zones with separate parkings and approaches. 

Nivo: 
The Northernmost zone which can be reached from the village of Nivo
Centrale: 
The central zone which can be reached the easiest from the village of Chironico
Altirolo: 
Lower zones of Centrale, parking is easier low down, near the village Altirolo. This will ease the approach. 
Schattental: 
Lower zone in the forest and river which can be reached by parking under the highway bridge at "via Ticinetto".

General Arrival: 
When coming from the North, the access to Ticino is through the Gotthard tunnel or pass (usually open from June to October). Once exiting the tunnel in Airolo, stay on the highway for another 20km and take exit 43-Faido. Drive direction SE on the secondary road (road 2). Once passed Lavorgo, take a right turn over the river and start driving up the switchbacks under the highway bridge (For Centrale and Nivo). 
To go to Schattental, keep driving south on road two until two large switchbacks bring you down lower. Turn right onto "Alla Monda" 1km after the switchbacks. Follow the road back north (one right turn), pass under the railway (close the fence for the hoses) and park under the big highway bridge. 
For Altirolo: Drive even more south on road 2, only turn right and cross the river in Giornico. Cross the railway and drive north on via Altirolo. Park at the boom.

Sectors: 
Approach paths are marked on the map and generally quite clear. 
Best zones for families are the Centrale and most of the blocks in the Nivo areas.

crags.name: Magic Wood
crags.access_info:
SLEEPING/CAMPING: Wild camping is forbidden. There's Bodhi camping area just before the village and Bodhi guest house at the Ausserferrera.

PARKING/ACCESS TO BOULDERS: There's two bridges. Lower goes from the Bodhi camping and upper one between the camping and Ausserferrera. There's big parking area next to the camping and very small one near the upper bridge.

BOULDERING AREA: Bouldering is allowed only on the marked area. Please check detailed map of the allowed area from the camping ground notice board or guide books.

LANDING: Many landings are rough. Often you'll need many crashpads and spotters.

GENERAL ACCESS INFORMATION: "To ALL the magic-hoppers‚Ä¶ its even getting uglier and uglier. just too many people up there this summer. and like everywhere else with a lot of people the probability of getting some idiots there is rising and rising. some dont pay the camping, just camp ‚Äúwild‚Äù in the wood, litter the place, agressive against the campgroundwarden, dont dare to say hello to anybody, no respect for nature, no respect for anything‚Ä¶. if the number of people (and the attached problems) are growing next year like it did this year, we have a good chance we will get serious problems with the local community and that everything will be shut down. SO its VERY important that IF you see BAD behaviour ‚Äî> to tell te people that they are wrong. very often they just dont know it better cause they have no idea about living in and with nature at all!!!" (http://sloper.climbing.nl/?p=974)

Even in 2018 there are still problems with the local community. So stay on the parking lots, NO absolutely NO wild camping in the whole valley. Please pay parking or camping fee. Use Toilets on Bodhi Camp or Edelweiss Guesthouse. (http://cleanclimbcelebrate.org)  Stay on pathes. NO fires and NO Graffity (like 2017!!!) Use your brain!!

There will be a CLEAN UP DAY organized by Bodhi Climbing once a year which takes normaly place after the final world cup competition in munich. This Year on weekend 25/26 august 2018!! So help and be part of the game!

crags.name: Almscliffe
crags.access_info:
https://www.thebmc.co.uk/modules/RAD/ViewCrag.aspx?id=465

The crag is on privately owned land and is not designated as open access. This means that it's very important that climbers look after the crag and behave well to maintain a good relationship with the farmer and the currently excellent access we enjoy.

03.11.2016: 
The farmer has recently asked for Almscliffe to not be used as a nightime/lamping venue and the BMC asks climbers to respect his wishes.

crags.name: Bridestones (Kebs)
crags.access_info:
Climbing on the Bridestone itself is prohibited - it has suffered from major erosion at its base and has been declared structurally unsafe.
When bouldering near the farm keep a low profile and noise levels down (avoid large groups) encourage others to abide by these guides and help protect climbing at this venue by following the usual ethos of clearing any rubbish, avoid brushing and remove excess chalk.

crags.name: Liljendal
crags.access_info:
There are cottages near the blocks. So don't venture too close to those, don't drive the roads past the parking and be super friendly. Bring your waving-hand and best smile.

üöó
From Helsinki: 85km | 1h
Find your way to the Porvoo highway (E18). Take exit 65 in order to turn toward Kouvola on road 6. 
Stay on road 6 for 11.8 km. Pass the shell in Liljendal (on your right), continue 2.1 km more and turn right onto Kirkkotie. Pass the frisbeegolf and turn right again. 
After 290, park in a laybay on the right. Do not drive past the layby, The road goes to cottages. The layby fits 4 cars (3 vans) when parked considerate. 
If the parking is full, you can drop off the pads and park at the frisbeegolf.

üö∂‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è
The approach is very easy. A path to Aires starts right from the parking (opposite side of the road), for other sectors, walking the road is easier. 
The trails are shown on the map.

crags.name: Djupviksgrottorna
crags.access_info:
Remember to pay the optional road fee to mailbox in Grottan parking area. ...as the keeping the road open is just as optional as paying the fee. No open fire is allowed. Also as camping is not allowed in √Öland - do not camp or perform Vanlife at parking of Climbing sectors -as any problems may end up closing the whole sector not just camping.

NEW: The speed limit in the beginning of Gravel road goes through the family's yard and has a 30 km/h speed limit. The limit is not been respected lately and the house owner is saying he will put a gate to block the route if the behavior does not change.

crags.name: F√•gelberget
crags.access_info: Driving on private roads is prohibited. Leave your car at Soltuna and walk to the boulders. More information is available at [SKIL's access blog]@[http://www.climbing.fi/skil/?q=node/24].

photo.caption: Paavo Ikonen sending Zen at F√•gelberget

crags.name: Kasviken
crags.access_info:
Use some sense when parking! Not many cars fit in the parking place. 

If all parking places are full, drive 500m - 1km longer along the way. There are several parking spots more.

Do not block access to the fields! More information is available at [SKIL's access blog]@[http://www.climbing.fi/skil/?q=node/24].

photo.caption: Ila Tuunainen approaching the crux jump of Kansallisongelma 7a+

crags.name: Kanavuori
crags.access_info:
K√§ytt√§k√§√§ merkattuja polkuja!

Kielletty√§:
- Leiriytyminen ja avotulen teko alueella
- Kiinteiden varmistusten k√§ytt√∂ lukuunottamatta yl√§ankkureita

Remember to use the marked paths!

Forbidden:
- to camp
- make fire
- adding bolts(except top anchors)

crags.name: Hurissalo
crags.access_info: don't leave any waste behind! Park the car so that you don't block others from passing you.

crags.name: Brione
crags.access_info:
üìù üôã Important notice from the local authority for the Boulder fans: 
The Verzasca community intends to offer climbers from all over the world the possibility to pursue their passion of bouldering. 

Obviously, there are rules that must be followed to ensure a peaceful coexistence of authorities, local population, and boulderers.
üîπ It is strictly forbidden to make fires in the open! 
üîπ  Please park in designated parking areas - Parking in agricultural areas and along the roads is not allowed! From 1/04 to 1/11 public parking lots are subject to fees. You can buy the "Verzasca Parking Card". costs: CHF 10/day | CHF 30/week
üîπ Camping is not allowed in the entire region.
üîπ Access to the meadows is prohibited from 31 March to 15 October. However, this particular area can be walked through during the mentioned time-span but without leaving the path! 
üîπ Dogs must be kept on lead at all times
üîπ Don't leave any rubbish such as cigarette butts, tape, bottles or plastic bags behind. Violators can be fined. 
üîπ Please respect our residents by not disturbing them - avoiding noise is much appreciated.

photo.caption: Diego Cameroni on Tu vu√≤ fa l'americano 8a

crags.name: Niemisel
crags.access_info:
Directions

The main wall is located 60km northwest of Lule√•. 

From Lule√• - Head north on E4 upp to exit "R√•ne√• N/Niemisel". Follow this road for 25km until you reach the village Niemisel. Drive past a small grocerystore and a former gasstation on your left and continue another 2km until you se some cliffs at your right. Drive approximatly 1 km further to a small remains of a forest road on your right side. 

Park your car and take the well trafficed path up to the crag and follow it for about  400 m. The path leads straight up to the crag by "Beavis" and "Butthead", the two routes further most to the right of the cliff.

photo.caption: Rasta-Jocke at Great balls of fire 7c

crags.name: Luppioberget
crags.access_info: Currently (summer 2021) there is a hotel construction work going on at Luppioberget. Climbers are still welcome during and after construction. Now the usual caf√© parking lot is not available but it should be possible to park about 100m before that. Please note that parking should not block the construction work traffic ! Also access to some of the boulders/routes is limited due to construction work, use your common sense here.

crags.name: Eggum
crags.access_info:
About 7 km after you've left the E10 towards Eggum, there'll be a parking available on your right. Coordinates (68.297823, 13.712971).

Park your car and walk about 120 meters towards Eggum, on your left there'll be a gate into a sheap garden. Follow the path there up to the crag.

crags.name: Stem Bastensen
crags.access_info:
From Svolv√¶r, follow the E10 westwards. About 1 km after the R√∏rvika beach and the turn off towards Henningsv√¶r a group of boulders appears on both sides of the road. There are two parking spots right after (north) the boulders, one on each side of the road. 

Note: Some of the problems on the boulders on the seaside of the road require low tide to be climbable.

crags.name: Presten boulders
crags.access_info: From R√∏rvika, follow the 816 towards Henningsv√¶r. After 3,5 km you have the Presten mountain on your left. An additional 500 m will bring you up a small hill and through a narrow section of the road. Just before and after this narrow section there are parking spots on your left. There‚Äôs also a parking spot on the pullout about 80 m south of the second parking. As always, make sure you‚Äôre not in the way of passing traffic.

photo.caption: Katarina Persson on the Presten Roof, short version, 7A+

crags.name: Gandalf bouldering
crags.access_info:
From R√∏rvika and the E10, follow the 816 road towards Henningsv√¶r. After about 5 km you will find yourself at the parking at Festv√•g. 
Note: The old parking that was on the right side of the road is no longer available, park at the large Festv√•g parking further down the road. To reach the Randalf wall go back to the old parking space and follow a path that leads down towards the ocean. The other boulders are situated on the other side of the road, below the rope climbing wall of Gandalf.

crags.name: Skokkelvika
crags.access_info:
Coming from Svolv√¶r: From the E10 take a left just after the bridge at Sundklakk and follow the 815 towards Valberg and Stamsund. After about 15 km you get to the Finnhamn beach. Continue along the 815 for about 1 km and you will have an open field on your right, where the boulders are situated. They really can't be missed.

Coming from Leknes: From Leknes, take the 815 towards Stamsund. After passing the twinlakes of Storfjordvatnet take a left towards Valberg and Justad. After about 22 km you will reach the meadow where the boulders are situated. They can't be missed. There is a parking space that can fit 2-3 cars on the left.

crags.name: Risryggen (a.k.a. Valberg)
crags.access_info: Follow the 815 road from either Leknes or the Sundklakk bridge. The boulder is situated east of Rolvsfjord, along the road. You really can't miss it. There is a parking space 100 meters east of the boulder.
